data.description:
Hit with a physics engine that feels more like tennis than any other game.  Move around the entire court while quickly and accurately lining up return shots.  Dominate the bot in drills, rallies, and matches then show your mettle online!

Get started with the basics for free.  When you're ready to unlock everything then upgrade to Pro for $14.99.

Court Time Tennis is the passion project of Eric Malafeew, who's played tennis consistently since age 10.  He also has 20+ years of game lead and simulation experience including VZfit, Rock Band, Guitar Hero, vehicle trainers and space robotics.

* Practice and play online matches around the world using your Meta avatar
* Move around the whole court and hit with realistic physics that you can tune
* Play indoors through a virtual portal or passthrough venue in larger spaces
* Earn stars and climb leaderboards with 20+ game drills, rallies, and the wall
* Choose between hardcourt, grass, or clay surfaces in park, club, and arena venues
* When you have the space to swing, attach your Quest controller to a real racket or extender
* Get ready for matches against the ball bot, and never have to pick up balls again
* Customize difficulty settings including wind and design your own drills

changelog.change_log:
RELEASE 1.8

New & changed:

Pro Mode gets customizable rackets
New Unlimited rally that doesn't reset you or the bot on misses and gives you 1000 balls
New Volley rally to practice against bot at the net
Adjustable "foot circle" option, to make bigger for larger play areas 
Added "ball trail" option to dial in the length you want
Lowered "racket bounce" minimum and maximum
Rename "racket grip" to "racket friction" and increase maximum
Increase maximum "random aim" in drill lab 
Increased maximum number of drill lab shots to 6
Widen max portal width by 50%
Added "nobody today" to challenge reply menu, which stops match requests from everybody 
Added "bot speed" options to Rally and Match modes
Teleport autorun option
"Either hand" rally option
"Short run" rally option now goes a bit farther

Other Improvements:
Changed default racket bounciness and friction
Support overheads with autorun and in drill lab
Draw balls even when they go outside portal
Prevent overly fast shots in assisted mode
Disabled virtual controller on racket hand
Smaller bulleye marker to match ball size
Fix for multiplayer games when point ends and server doesn't get the ball
Fix for rare laser pointer disappearance
When other player leaves multiplayer, return to lobby after 3 seconds
Correctly show Quest3 controllers
Allow multiplayer receiver to move before first serve
Bot waits to serve in passthrough venue match until player is in position
Fixed mixed reality capture support
Fix menu button resume behavior on the drill lab select menu and other places
Save left and right hand controller offsets separately
Allow Y/B to toggle menu in one-controller mode
Raise minimum contact height for autopositioning

Bugfixes:
More accurate line calling
Fix second serves in multiplayer
Brighten assist effect on racket
Fixed bug with "full autorun" and when point ends quickly
Tweaked tutorial
Better challenge messaging
Fixed one-controller movement direction
Fixed "random volley" targets off court
Keep portal position after headset sleeps
Don't clip ghost racket with portal
Allow held Y/B to delete drills in one-controller mode
Don't show bounce marker on player side after bot volley
Don't reset player position in Unlimited Rally
Shot leaderboards at end of rallies
Fix handling of offline due to Meta server changes
Hitting after second bounce doesn't affect point
Fix multiplayer request blockage
